questions.question_text: Which of the following would an adversary do while conducting an evil twin attack?

choices.B: Manipulate address resolution to point devices to a malicious endpoint.
choices.D: Capture data in transit between two legitimate endpoints to steal data.
choices.A: Trick users into using an AP with an SSID that is identical to a legitimate network.
choices.C: Present an identical MAC to gain unauthorized access to network resources.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
An evil twin attack takes place when an attacker sets up a fake Wi-Fi access point hoping that users will connect to it instead of a legitimate one.
 hacker has set up an evil twin network with an identical SSID name.

comments.content: After revisiting thisone i take my first answer back. The ISP has given the company a /28 block so changing the subnet mask to 255.255.255.240 will align with the ISPs given block. Yes, A is the correct one.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Option A: Changing the subnet mask to .240 (which would be /23 in CIDR notation) might not resolve the issue as it alters the subnet range and could cause misaddressing of devices within the current network.

Option B: Altering the Ethernet cable configuration from an external interface to a modem is unrelated to IP routing or subnetting, so this option does not address the root cause of the problem.

Option C: Modifying the CIDR to /29 would move beyond the intended /28 subnets, which might be unnecessary and could lead to issues with existing networks.

Option D: Changing the static IP from 98.174.235.142/28 to 98.174.235.128/28 is the most likely solution. This adjustment involves updating the specific IP address, which affects how devices are routed through the network. By changing the static IP, the company can ensure proper routing of devices within their /28 network without affecting other networks.

Selected Answer: A
You need to change the subnet mask

choices.B: Change the Ethernet cable from the external interface to the modem.

questions.question_text: An ISP provided a company with an IP range of 98.174.235.142/28. A network technician configured a router with a subnet mask of 255.255.255.224 and default gateway of 98.174.235.129. After the configuration was set up. the company is unable to connect to the ISP. Which of the following would resolve this issue?

A network administrator is troubleshooting a connection between two switches that is experiencing intermittent errors. The administrator needs to determine which port on the remote switch the faulty cable is connected to. Which of the following is the best tool to use to identify the error?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
When there's a connection problem between two switches, enabling "lldp run" (which stands for "Link Layer Discovery Protocol run") helps identify the issue by allowing the switches to exchange information about their connected neighbors, revealing whether the link is truly down or if there's a configuration problem on either switch, thus aiding in troubleshooting network connectivity issues between them. 
Key points about LLDP in this scenario:
Neighbor discovery:
LLDP essentially acts as a "hello" message between devices, letting each switch know which devices are directly connected to it on a specific port. 
Identifying link status:
By checking the LLDP information received from a neighboring switch, you can quickly determine if the link is up or down. 
Troubleshooting potential issues:
If a switch isn't receiving LLDP packets from its neighbor, it could indicate a cable problem, port configuration issues, or a faulty switch.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a difference between EOL and EOS?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
EOL discontinues the product.

choices.A: EOL discontinues the product but may offer support.
choices.B: EOS replaces free support with a subscription model.
choices.C: EOS only applies to physical products.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
f the architectâ€™s concern is the performance and security of data transfer between an on-premises data center and the cloud, especially for hybrid cloud environments, Direct Connect would be the optimal choice. It provides dedicated, private connectivity that ensures low-latency and high-bandwidth connections, making it ideal for mission-critical applications, backup, and cloud migration.

Selected Answer: A
A hot site is a fully operational backup facility that mirrors the primary site. It's kept up-to-date with the latest data and configurations, so in the event of a major outage at the primary site, operations can be seamlessly switched over to the hot site with minimal disruption.
